member_organisations: Membership is confidential, but our board of directors is listed here: http://www.nam.org/About/Board-of-Directors/
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Environment, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
·         Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership (T-TIP) negotiations with the United States  
·         Policies, regulations and standards that impact manufacturers in the United States, including the U.S.-EU Privacy Shield Framework Agreement, the Restriction on Hazardous Substances Directive (RoHS), Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH); and conflict minerals  
  
·         Investment, intellectual property, competition policy, energy and environment measures
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
position: Vice President, International Economic Affairs Policy
relevant_communication: The NAM participates in policy implementation through comments, letters, reports and meetings as well as public events and communications to explain positions and provide information on subject topics.
goals__remit: The National Association of Manufacturers (NAM) is the largest manufacturing association in the United States, representing small and large manufacturers in every industrial sector and in all 50 states. Manufacturing employs over 12 million men and women, contributes roughly $2.17 trillion to the U.S. economy annually, has the largest economic impact of any major sector and accounts for three-quarters of private-sector research and development. Its mission is to enhance the competitiveness of manufacturers and improve American living standards by shaping a legislative and regulatory environment conducive to U.S. economic growth.
